intro: Eritrichium chorisianum, commonly known as the alpine mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as cabbages and mustards. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with hairy stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale purple, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, alpine environments.
